title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 July 2013 - XWiki
content:

12:10 <geo\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:10 <geo\_> Hi i have one issue on url of sub wiki  
12:11 <geo\_> In all created sub wikis the url is starting http://localhost:8080/xwiki...  
12:12 <geo\_> Please let us know how can chnage it to our main wiki domain name... We are using path based domain access..  
12:23 <geo\_> has quit  
12:51 <tdelafosse> has quit  
13:07 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:18 <tekzilla> argh, all the troubles i had yesterday with setting the XAR upload limit, were cache/proxy related, sorry  
13:18 <tekzilla> thanks for the help :)  
13:45 <mflorea> has quit  
13:46 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <vmassol> tekzilla: cool :)  
13:48 <vmassol> msmeria: hi, did you have the time to test the horizontal menu for 5.1?  
13:48 <vmassol> (http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9148)  
13:50 <msmeria> vmassol: hi  
13:50 <msmeria> I didn't test that  
13:51 <vmassol> msmeria: would be nice if you could test it since it's part of the 5.1 release  
13:51 <vmassol> so you didn't finish with testing 5.1?  
13:51 <msmeria> I didn't do a full test for 5.1  
13:51 <vmassol> no no  
13:52 <vmassol> I'm defintiely not talking about full test  
13:52 <msmeria> I only looked at the jira issues and also tested Solr  
13:52 <vmassol> you did that for RC1 already  
13:52 <vmassol> as usual you need to l ook at the release notes  
13:52 <vmassol> and test the new stuff specficially  
13:52 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki51  
13:52 <vmassol> menu app is new in 5.1  
13:53 <msmeria> I see  
13:53 <msmeria> I'll look at it now  
13:53 <vmassol> ok thanks  
13:53 <msmeria> np  
13:54 <vmassol> btw guys, I wonder if we shouldn't put back the "resolved" state in the jira workflow with the rule that devs mark issues as resolved and someone else than the assignee put it as closed only after he's tested it to work  
13:55 <vmassol> msmeria: note that I was wrong and the menu app is there since RC1  
13:55 <vmassol> (see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki51RC1)  
14:00 <msmeria> it's the first I hear about it, but from now on I'll look closer at the RN :)  
14:00 <msmeria> usually I only looked at the Jira issued fixed for that version  
14:00 <msmeria> but new features must work also  
14:02 <msmeria> issues\*  
14:07 <vmassol> yes RN is the most important to look at  
14:07 <vmassol> it contains everything to be tested usually  
14:12 <camil7> istn the Application.properties with the translations generated from i10n.xwiki.org ?  
14:13 <camil7> er, I meant http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/L10N/  
14:13 <vmassol> yes, except for the English version AFAIK  
14:13 <camil7> ah, I see :)  
14:14 <vmassol> but I may we wrong...  
14:14 <camil7> no, english is actually missing, I only see now ... should have checked before  
14:18 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
14:18 <tmortagne> the english is the reference one and is not exported from l10n wiki yes  
14:19 <vmassol> which means that we need PR for english translations  
14:19 <tmortagne> technically it's not really the english version but the default version  
14:22 <sburjan`> has quit  
14:26 <camil7> yes, it is even mentioned ion l10n, I was just no lazy to read :-/  .... to have an en-translation one would need to have an Application\_en.properties ... and then that would be redundant to the default version.  
14:31 <tmortagne> we could have english variants (but that means we would need to be clear on which variant is the default one)  
14:32 <msmeria> tmortagne: I get the DW each time I create a new wiki on XEM  
14:32 <msmeria> on 5.2-snap  
14:32 <tmortagne> msmeria: do you have the snapshot repository in your xwiki.properties ?  
14:33 <tmortagne> at least did you have it when you created the template  
14:33 <msmeria> tmortagne: no and no  
14:33 <msmeria> I didn't modify any file in the zip  
14:33 <msmeria> I'm on jetty/hsqldb/manager  
14:34 <tmortagne> there is a jira issue about that already, the issue is that the template is created from a xar so if XWiki cannot find the corresponding extension on any repository when it's imported it does not register it as extension  
14:34 <tmortagne> which mean DW thing you don't have any installed extension in your new wiki  
14:34 <msmeria> ok. just wanted to let you know  
14:36 <tmortagne> msmeria: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9194  
14:37 <msmeria> yes, that's exactly my issue too  
14:46 <vmassol> has quit

15:49 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
16:12 <camil7> it seems the l10n.wiki.org  has no page for the translation of 'no'  (while it has one for 'yes')  
16:13 <camil7> just wondering, because most of the dialogs ("do you really want to ....") are using them, and the translations are missing at least for 'de'  
16:13 <tmortagne> camil7: there is a key named "no" ?  
16:14 <camil7> tmortagne: yes, e.g. used in templates/resubmit.vm:  $services.localization.render('no')  
16:15 <camil7> also in templates/delete.vm  
16:15 <tmortagne> right there is one in ApplicationResources.properties  
16:19 <camil7> ah, it is not in the search, but one can "guess" is ... "Yes" document is here: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/inline/Platform/PlatformXWikiCoreResources\_119527\_yes\_de  
16:20 <camil7> so "no" document might be here: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/inline/Platform/PlatformXWikiCoreResources\_119528\_no\_de  ... ah, no, it is not  
16:21 <Guest81988> has quit  
16:21 <camil7> page seems to exist, but has no L10NCode.TranslationClass object  
16:22 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:23 <tmortagne> looking  
16:28 <tmortagne> there seems to be something weird with this key indeed, even the yes one actually, can't find it on default side  
16:28 <tmortagne> trying to understand what is the issue, good catch  
16:30 <camil7> maybe the mechanism creating the pages on l10n from the Application.properties does not really like such short keys  
16:31 <tmortagne> I don't see why but yes for some reason theses keys have not been created  
16:39 <kstuart> has quit  
16:46 <tmortagne> it does not seems to be a short key issue since I can find keys like http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/inline/Platform/PlatformXWikiCoreResources\_3707\_to\_en  
16:47 <tmortagne> might be more by move from XE to Platform that broke some pages...  
16:47 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <evalica> has quit  
16:57 <camil7> ah, ok, seems I just found one my accident  
16:57 <tmortagne> camil7: just imported them  
16:57 <tmortagne> I was about to say It :)  
16:58 <tmortagne> no I need to find why the scheduler that is supposed to do this import every night obviously does not work anymore  
16:58 <camil7> ah, ok, so "sort by last modified" helps to find them ?  
16:58 <tmortagne> s/no/now/  
16:58 <tmortagne> I did not really fixed anything actually  
16:59 <tmortagne> just forced what is supposed to be done every night  
16:59 <tmortagne> which imported the missing keys  
17:00 <tmortagne> and yes you should find them by looking at latest modified documents  
17:01 <camil7> tmortagne: ah, now I see the 'no' document, thanks!  
17:01 <tmortagne> there was actually quite a few missing keys...  
17:01 <camil7> even in the "normal" i10n search ...  
17:01 <tmortagne> lets see that scheduler now...  
17:02 <camil7> sometimes even a scheduler needs a bit personal attention from time to time ;)  
17:03 <tmortagne> yea, what is really missing is an isolated log of what happen during the last scheduler execution, like we have for extensions install and all stuff based on new job module  
17:05 <camil7> btw as we are at strange things I see on the start page on www.xwiki.org a reference to "Mavenbook" by Mavenbook.org  which links to a "Main/No longer available" page  
17:06 <tmortagne> indeed, no idea what it was supposed to link to  
17:06 <tmortagne> vmassol ?  
17:08 <camil7> maybe the "random selection" of the "Powered by XWiki" widget also select outdated references  
17:10 <vmassol> catching up  
17:11 <vmassol> yes that was my book  
17:11 <vmassol> doesn't exist any longer  
17:12 <vmassol> (the book still exists but not the web site ;))  
17:20 <vmassol> ok broken links should be fixed now  
17:22 <camil7> yes, I see (or more precise I do no longer see them)  
17:23 <vmassol> yah I had to refresh the cache  
17:23 <vmassol> so you're seeing another ref for now  
17:23 <vmassol> but if you go to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/References/Mavenbook there's no broken links any longer  
17:24 <vmassol> camil7: maybe you can help us understand the email from Matthias Schoeppe?  
17:24 <vmassol> he says  
17:24 <vmassol> "What is with your page  
17:24 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/References/WebHome ?  
17:24 <vmassol> "  
17:24 <vmassol> but I don't understand what is the question  
17:24 <vmassol> any idea?  
17:25 <camil7> reading ...  
17:27 <camil7> well, two possible explanations:  when he looked at th references, maybe the page was broken (might just been a glitch in his browser, or a timeout when getting ajax results from the livetable due to a perturbation in the force)  
17:28 <vmassol> ok I'll ask anyway thought maybe it's was a bad german translation :)  
17:28 <camil7> or he just did not like the first references, or even missed the "paging" buttoin in the lower rigth, assuming it is only 15 refs there  
17:29 <camil7> or it was something completely else - maybe he really things 127 references are not many ;)  
17:30 <camil7> anyway, even if one assumes this is German English, I still understand it as "looks like there are only very little references"  
17:30 <vmassol> anyway I just replied  
17:30 <vmassol> :)  
17:30 <vmassol> thzanks  
17:33 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:54 <camil7> it seems the extension manager in the Wiki Admin UI is not much useful for users without programming rights; i.e. they cannot install or update anything  
17:54 <camil7> would it be better not to hide this part to all uses except users with programming rights ?  
17:56 <vmassol> camil7: You mean hiding the EM UI for admin users without PR?  
17:57 <camil7> vmassol: yes, something like that  
17:58 <vmassol> if it's not already the case then yes we should do this  
17:59 <camil7> as users who only exists in virtual wikis have no programming rights it seems this is not yet these case  
18:00 <camil7> then I can think of a few people who would like to have programming rights for "virtual wiki" only admins ....  
18:02 <vmassol> ok it's a good idea, would be great if you could create a jira issue  
18:02 <vmassol> (camil7)  
18:03 <camil7> yes, ok, taking a note to do so tomorrow  
18:05 <vmassol> thanks  
18:06 <vmassol> just sent a mail about the 5.2 roadmap on the devs list if you have stuff you guys want to work on during 5.2 and want to make that visible ;)  
18:06 <camil7> just managed to scrap my local dev instance - I guess this wants to tell me to stop for today  ;)  
18:06 <vmassol> ouch  
18:06 <vmassol> :)  
18:16 <Denis> has quit  
18:19 <camil7> has quit  
18:23 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
18:31 <kstuart> has quit  
18:31 <tekzilla> a quick question: is there any way to retain the CREATION date of a page after an import ?  
18:32 <tekzilla> the full history is there, but the creation date displayed is the import date  
18:33 <mflorea> has quit  
18:43 <vmassol> tekzilla: strange, if you keep history it should be the original date  
18:48 <tekzilla> i chose to "Replace the document history with the history from the package" and "Import as backup package"  
18:49 <tekzilla> please let me know if thats wrong in this case, i just want to go from 3.0 to 5.1  
18:51 <tekzilla> and thx for reading :) driving home now..  
18:55 <vmassol> what you did should be ok  
18:55 <vmassol> so it looks like a potential bug  
18:59 <tdelafosse> has quit  
18:59 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki
